It is a small, cryptogamic plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions. The plant has a simple morphology, characterized by its closely spaced, elongated leaves that are often arranged in a spiral pattern. It reproduces through spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporangia located on the leaf tips. Didymoglossum krausii plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
